data.text: @DaveHPT This one has been sent to me a few times today - As always they are quite funny.

@seancondev @natalie_j1402 Another math failure. Pretend there’s 100 people. 85 of them are vaccinated. 10% of the 85 will still get covid. 8.5 people.  Now take the 15 people.  Half of them get covid.  7.5 people.  Sigh. The difference is the 8.5 people might have to go the hosp but they’re leaving alive
@AlbertWestie @BillTufts I was able to grab it again - just need to change 2 selectors as highlighted: https://t.co/eYxdt8M5fH

@seancondev @BillTufts Funny thing this graph is no longer available on the site
Hahahaha

@seancondev Individuals ARE entitled and able to abstain from treatment even when that is not in their best interests.

Doctors are and should be required to treat in accordance with best available evidence. Not whatever on a whim or a hunch, or whatever the patient asks for.

@DaveHPT I borrowed your prescription to make that statement friend.

What I am saying is your position of a single treatment, one size fits all is not appropriate. Labelling people who want a balanced approach to treatment led by the treating doctor anti-vaccine is also not appropriate.
